thread.title: Patriots rout Cowboys, 30-6, to remain undefeated - Patriots
thread.title_full: Patriots rout Cowboys, 30-6, to remain undefeated - Patriots

author: Chris Greenberg
title: Patriots rout Cowboys, 30-6, to remain undefeated - Patriots
text:
The Patriots picked up another win and a franchise record while in Dallas.
New England improved to 4-0 with a 30-6 win over the Cowboys at AT&T Stadium on Sunday. Quarterback Tom Brady threw for 275 yards and two touchdowns while adding his first rushing touchdown since 2012 as the Patriots established a new franchise record for points through four games (149).
“We’ve got to keep it going,” Brady told reporters after the win. “It’s a long season, we’re only four games into it.”
Advertisement - Continue Reading Below Watch for the Tom Brady QB-keeper TD Stay for the #BradySpike and LET'S GO reaction. #NEvsDAL http://t.co/Tqm20CMmqT
— NFL (@NFL) October 11, 2015 With defensive end Greg Hardy and linebacker Rolando McClain back from four-game suspensions, the Cowboys’ defense sacked Brady five times in the first half and notched eight quarterback hits overall. The Patriots’ defense limited the Brandon Weeden-led Cowboys offense to just two field goals and 264 total yards.
Patriots wide receiver Julian Edelman tallied 120 receivng yards and a touchdown. Running backs Dion Lewis and LeGarrette Blount combined for 107 rushing yards. Lewis also added a receiving touchdown.
Dion Lewis. http://t.co/xJ4pr22q0A #NEvsDAL
— New England Patriots (@Patriots) October 11, 2015 The Patriots visit the Colts in Week 6 for a rematch of the most recent AFC Championship Game.
More to come .
